content.description: Sit start on a jug shelf with feet out right on big holds, pull on, rock the right knee in and reach up with the right hand into the seam half-way up the boulder, match it, then reach up to the sloping lip of the boulder, match again here and then get high feet and make a big reach up to a flat and easy topout.
content.location: Rightmost problem on the Farewell boulder, it is visible from the yellow marked trail on the woods side, away from the pond.

content.description: Sit start in the middle of the slab face, right hand undercling and left hand on a bad crimp; pull on to the boulder and make a reach up with the right hand to a good crimp then use the vertical seam/other holds on the slab to press yourself up and onto the slab face. From here continue straight on up through the slab to the top.
content.location: Middle of the Farewell boulder, on the side that is facing the water, underneath the slab that Blue Star traverses through.

content.description: Did you figure out after the top out why it is called blue star?
content.protection: Put a pad just to the right of the jug where you traverse into the next horizontal crack
content.location: Variation of Adventure Around the Wayside.  Start hold in photo.  Move right following the obvious crack around the corner, pull into a higher crack after a mantle over lichen, and then traverse the crack to a jug.  Move down off the jug into the next horizontal crack, finishing straight up.

content.description: Start on the bottom of the crack in the picture.  Pull left through and undercling and bump to a good hold, and then slap up a sloper or two until you find a slightly incut hold.  Top out straight up.  Cleaned just enough to send
content.protection: One pad with a spotter will suffice
content.location: Start is around the corner to the left when facing the boulder from yellow trail

climbs.name: A Long Adventure Around the Wayside

content.protection: 2 rock and a tree at the crack to top out, pad is fine
content.location: Start on the left side of the boulder. Two hand flake, working your way to the right. Feet are high so a little bit of a tight shuffle. Low feet as you round the corner to a high crack. Then up to another crack, elevating up to the right to a vertical crack with a jug at the top. Climb straight up to top out.  Variation, which brings you into Blue Star, is to climb down right from the jug.
